data.title: 1107). Peintre et Connaisseur d'Art dans la Perspective de l'Esthetique des Lettres.

data.meta_description: Paris: Presses Universitaires de France, 1963., 1963.. Very good. - Octavo, 10 inches high by 6-1/2 inches wide. Softcover, bound in pictorial tan wrappers titl
data.text: Paris: Presses Universitaires de France, 1963., 1963.. Very good. - Octavo, 10 inches high by 6-1/2 inches wide. Softcover, bound in pictorial tan wrappers titled in black on the front cover and on the spine with a blue, black & cream vignette on the front cover. The corners of the covers are very lightly bumped and there are vertical creases down the spine. 346 & [1] unopened pages, illustrated with 8 plates and a map. The bottom corners of the last several pages are bumped & creased. Very good. First edition. Annales du Musee Guimet Tome 70. Mi Fu (1051-1107) was a Chinese painter, poet and calligrapher who was born in Taiyuan during the Song dynasty. He became known for his style of painting misty landscapes. He was one of the greatest calligraphers of the Song dynasty. First Edition.
